item.title: Report E-2023060816
item.description:
Report E-2023060816

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-02
  • City: HOLBROOK
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UAQ experienced an over the road release of UN1760 Clothesline Fresh BLD Detergent from (3) 5-gallon poly pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor and a 1' x 1' area of the gravel/soil below. Citric acid & oil dri were deployed to clean impacted areas. The impacted soil was shoveled up and backfilled. The damaged pails and cleanup debris were then placed into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was removed from site pending disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023060796
item.description:
Report E-2023060796

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading a truck at Veolia's ten day intransit facility in Phoenix, AZ, Veolia employees observed a 275 gallon tote to be leaking. Further investigation revealed there was corrosion to the floor pan of the tote that rusted enough to create a sharp edge. The sharp edge punctured the bottom of the tote's bladder resulting in a release of material from the tote. The contents of the tote were transferred to a new tote for continued transportation. Spill pads were used by Veolia personnel to cleanup the released material. It is believed that the corrosion was likely due to the tote being staged/stored outside at the shipper's location.

item.title: Report X-2023060675
item.description:
Report X-2023060675

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-25
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 05/24/2023 at approximately 1945, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 3801288 at a station location in Phoenix , reporting an spilling involving an undeclared corrosive liquid. The shipment consisted of two fiberboard boxes, each containing two plastic contaiiners of liquid. Upon discovery, one of the boxes appeared damp on the bottom. Further investigation revealed the screw top on one of the containers had loosened, causing the contents to completely spill. The attached safety data sheet idenetified the commodity as UN 1760. Neither of the package were prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations as they were missing the marking, labeling, packaging, and paperwork. The entire shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.
